item.title: [PI] Sending a message when an object is spawned
item.dc:creator: @Darkmist Darkmist
item.description:
@Darkmist wrote:

Sorry im not sure how to explain it, But im making a small hide and seek thing were the server will give out a hint when the object spawns

Basically what i need is the server to check if the object is spawned and to keep repeating the Hinted message every 6 minutes or so… I hope that makes a little more sence xD

item.title: [PI] Sending a message when an object is spawned
item.dc:creator: @Darkmist Darkmist
item.description:
@Darkmist wrote:

Hey guys, Im making a system which requires a server message to send every, 6 or so minutes, when an object is spanwed by the server… Now i was gonna try use this code

public void servermessages() { EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { public void execute(EventContainer c) { sendMessage("[Server] My message"); } }, 60000); // Time it takes to send the message };

But im unsure on how to make it send when the object is spawned, and to stop sending when the object has been clicked, If someone could please help me id very much appreciate it

Thanks in advance

Read full topic
